text: [Application] A site plan uses scale 1:200. A wall of actual length 6 m should be drawn as:
To divide a segment in ratio m:n, you first construct any acute-angled ray from one endpoint.
answer: True

text: For reduction (m/n < 1), you mark n equal parts and draw parallel through the m-th division.
answer: True

text: Tangents from an internal point of a circle can be drawn with ruler–compass.
answer: False

text: [Application] A drawing with scale 1:50 is larger than actual object.
answer: False

text: To draw tangents from T to the circle (center O), one constructs circle with diameter OT and joins T to intersection points with the given circle.
answer: True

text: Construct the internal division point P of segment AB (8 cm) in the ratio 5:3 (AP:PB = 5:3). Describe steps.
answer:
Step 1: Draw AB = 8 cm. From A, draw a ray AX making an acute angle with AB.
Step 2: On AX, mark 8 equal points A1, A2, …, A8 using equal compass width.
Step 3: Join A8 to B.
Step 4: Through A5, draw a line ∥ A8B to meet AB at P (use parallel via corresponding angles with set-square/compass construction).
Step 5: Then AP:PB = 5:3. Verify by measuring.

text: Construct △A'B'C' similar to △ABC with scale 3/5 (i.e., A'B'/AB = 3/5). Describe steps.
answer:
Step 1: Draw △ABC.
Step 2: From A, draw ray AX making an acute angle with AB.
Step 3: Mark 5 equal segments A1…A5 on AX.
Step 4: Join A5 to B.
Step 5: Through A3, draw A3B' ∥ A5B to cut AC at C'.
Step 6: Through C', draw B'C' ∥ BC to meet AB at B'. Then △A'B'C' ≡ △AB'C' with A'≡A; scale = 3/5.

text: Construct △A'B'C' similar to △ABC with scale 5/3 (i.e., enlargement). Describe steps.
answer:
Step 1: Draw △ABC.
Step 2: From A draw ray AX with an acute angle to AB.
Step 3: Mark 5 equal segments A1…A5 on AX.
Step 4: Join A3 to B.
Step 5: Through A5, draw A5B' ∥ A3B to meet the line through A parallel to AB extended beyond B; obtain B'.
Step 6: Through B' draw line ∥ BC to meet line through A ∥ AC at C'. Then △AB'C' is similar to △ABC with scale 5/3.

text: Construct tangents from external point T to a circle with center O. Give steps with diagram note: 'Given: circle (O, r); external point T'.
answer:
Step 1: Draw line OT.
Step 2: Construct midpoint M of OT (perpendicular bisector of OT).
Step 3: With center M and radius OM, draw a circle (circle with diameter OT).
Step 4: Let this circle cut the given circle at P and Q.
Step 5: Join TP and TQ. These are the required tangents from T.

text: [Application] On a map, scale is 1:25,000. Construct a straight road segment of actual length 2 km as a line segment on paper. How long will you draw? Give steps.
answer:
Step 1: Convert 2 km to cm: 2 km = 200,000 cm.
Step 2: Drawing length = Actual/Scale = 200,000 / 25,000 = 8 cm.
Step 3: With ruler, draw a straight 8 cm segment to represent the road; label ends.

text: [Application] A model uses scale 1:50. Represent an actual 3.5 m beam as a line on drawing. Give the drawing length and steps.
answer:
Step 1: Convert 3.5 m = 350 cm.
Step 2: Drawing length = 350/50 = 7 cm.
Step 3: Draw a 7 cm segment with ruler; label to scale 1:50.

text: Divide AB internally and externally in the ratio 7:4 using a single auxiliary ray. Provide complete steps.
answer:
Internal division:
Step 1: Draw AB. From A draw ray AX making an acute angle with AB.
Step 2: Mark 11 equal points A1…A11 on AX.
Step 3: Join A11 to B.
Step 4: Through A7, draw a line ∥ A11B to meet AB at P. Then AP:PB = 7:4 (internal).
External division:
Step 5: Produce AB beyond B.
Step 6: Through A4, draw a line ∥ A11B to meet the produced line beyond B at Q. Then AQ:QB = 7:4 (external).

text: Construct a triangle similar to △ABC with scale factor 3/5 and write how to verify the scale on your figure.
answer:
Construction:
Step 1: Draw △ABC.
Step 2: From A, draw ray AX at an acute angle to AB; mark 5 equal divisions A1…A5.
Step 3: Join A5 to B.
Step 4: Through A3 draw A3B' ∥ A5B to meet AC at C'.
Step 5: Through C' draw B'C' ∥ BC to meet AB at B'. Then △AB'C' ~ △ABC with scale 3/5.
Verification:
Step 6: Measure AB' and AB; confirm AB'/AB ≈ 3/5. Similarly check AC'/AC ≈ 3/5 and B'C'/BC ≈ 3/5.

text: From a point T outside a given circle (center O), construct two tangents and justify that the lengths are equal.
answer:
Construction:
Step 1: Draw OT and find midpoint M of OT.
Step 2: With M as center and radius OM, draw circle with diameter OT.
Step 3: Let it intersect the given circle at P and Q.
Step 4: Join TP and TQ ⇒ tangents.
Justification:
Step 5: OP ⟂ TP and OQ ⟂ TQ (radius ⟂ tangent at point of contact).
Step 6: In right triangles OPT and OQT, OT is common hypotenuse and OP=OQ (radii). Hence TP=TQ.

text: [Application] A classroom (actual) is 9.0 m × 6.0 m. Draw its scaled rectangle on graph paper using scale 1:150, and list steps.
answer:
Step 1: Convert to cm: 9.0 m = 900 cm, 6.0 m = 600 cm.
Step 2: Drawing lengths: 900/150 = 6 cm; 600/150 = 4 cm.
Step 3: On paper, draw AB = 6 cm.
Step 4: At A and B, draw perpendiculars; mark AD = 4 cm and BC = 4 cm.
Step 5: Join DC to complete rectangle ABCD; label scale 1:150.

text: [Application] A circular garden of radius 3 cm (in drawing) represents actual radius 6 m. From a gate point T (on plan) lying 10 cm from center O (on plan), construct tangents to the garden boundary. Write steps.
answer:
Step 1: On plan, draw circle (O, 3 cm).
Step 2: Plot external point T so that OT = 10 cm.
Step 3: Find midpoint M of OT; draw circle (M, OM).
Step 4: Intersections with garden circle are P and Q.
Step 5: Draw TP and TQ. These are tangents representing paths from gate to boundary.

options: Radius OP and a line ⟂ to OP at P

text: [Application] A plot is to be drawn at scale 1:500. An actual side of 35 m appears as:
In tangent construction from T to circle (O, r), the circle with diameter OT intersects the given circle at:
options: Points of contact of required tangents
Endpoints of diameter of given circle

External division point Q lies on:
options: Extension of AB beyond B (or A)

text: To construct a tangent at point P on the circle, draw the radius OP and a line perpendicular to OP at P.
answer: True

text: In external division construction for ratio m:n, the parallel is drawn through the m-th division point.
answer: False

text: [Application] Scale 1:250 means 1 cm on drawing equals 2.5 m in reality.
answer: True

text: All constructions of similar triangles start from vertex B.
answer: False

text: The circle with diameter OT is used to locate the points of tangency for tangents from T.
answer: True

text: Construct the external division point Q of AB (7 cm) in ratio 3:2 (AQ:QB = 3:2) beyond B. Describe steps.
answer:
Step 1: Draw AB = 7 cm; extend AB beyond B.
Step 2: From A, draw ray AX at an acute angle with AB.
Step 3: Mark 5 equal points A1…A5 on AX.
Step 4: Join A5 to B.
Step 5: Through A3 draw a line ∥ A5B to meet extension of AB at Q (beyond B).
Step 6: Then AQ:QB = 3:2 (external division).

text: Construct a tangent at a given point P on a circle with center O. Write steps.
answer:
Step 1: Draw radius OP.
Step 2: At P, construct a line perpendicular to OP (using compass: take equal arcs on OP; draw arcs above/below; join through P).
Step 3: The line through P ⟂ OP is the required tangent at P.

text: Construct △A'B'C' similar to △ABC with scale 4/7 (smaller). Steps only.
answer:
Step 1: Draw △ABC. From A draw ray AX with acute angle to AB.
Step 2: Mark 7 equal points A1…A7 on AX.
Step 3: Join A7B.
Step 4: Through A4 draw A4B' ∥ A7B to meet AC at C'.
Step 5: Through C' draw B'C' ∥ BC to meet AB at B'. Then △AB'C' is similar with scale 4/7.

text: Construct △A'B'C' similar to △ABC with scale 7/4 (enlargement). Steps only.
answer:
Step 1: Draw △ABC. From A draw ray AX at acute angle to AB.
Step 2: Mark 7 equal points A1…A7 on AX.
Step 3: Join A4B.
Step 4: Through A7 draw A7B' ∥ A4B to obtain B'.
Step 5: Through B' draw line ∥ BC to meet line through A ∥ AC at C'. Then △AB'C' ~ △ABC with scale 7/4.

text: Construct tangents from T to a circle (O, r). Write how to identify points of contact after construction.
answer:
Step 1: Draw OT and find its midpoint M.
Step 2: Draw circle with center M and radius OM.
Step 3: Intersections with the given circle are P and Q.
Step 4: Join TP, TQ as tangents.
Identification: P and Q are points of contact; verify OP ⟂ TP and OQ ⟂ TQ by constructing right angles at P and Q.

text: [Application] On a blueprint scale 1:100, show a 12.5 m boundary line as a segment. Find drawing length and give steps.
answer:
Step 1: 12.5 m = 1250 cm.
Step 2: Drawing length = 1250/100 = 12.5 cm.
Step 3: Draw a straight 12.5 cm segment with ruler; label endpoints and scale.

text: [Application] A circular water tank is shown with plan radius 2.4 cm (scale 1:200). From a valve point T at 8.0 cm from O on plan, draw access tangents. Steps.
answer:
Step 1: Plan circle (O, 2.4 cm) already drawn; plot T with OT = 8.0 cm.
Step 2: Midpoint M of OT; draw circle (M, OM).
Step 3: Intersections with tank circle give P, Q.
Step 4: Draw TP, TQ as access tangents.

text: Divide AB internally in 2:5 using intercept method. Steps only.
answer:
Step 1: Draw AB. From A draw ray AX.
Step 2: Mark 7 equal points A1…A7 on AX.
Step 3: Join A7B.
Step 4: Through A2 draw a line ∥ A7B to meet AB at P. Then AP:PB = 2:5.

text: Construct a triangle similar to △PQR with scale factor 2/3 (smaller) taking P as the common vertex. Also explain how to check correctness.
answer:
Construction:
Step 1: Draw △PQR.
Step 2: From P draw ray PX at an acute angle to PR.
Step 3: Mark 3 equal divisions P1,P2,P3 on PX.
Step 4: Join P3R.
Step 5: Through P2 draw a line ∥ P3R to meet PR at R'.
Step 6: Through R' draw a line ∥ RQ to meet PQ at Q'. Then △PQ'R' ~ △PQR with scale 2/3 (taking vertex P common).
Check:
Step 7: Measure ratios: PQ'/PQ ≈ PR'/PR ≈ Q'R'/QR ≈ 2/3.

text: Divide a given segment AB of 10 cm internally in the ratio 4:7 and externally in the same ratio using a single ray. List full steps.
answer:
Internal:
Step 1: Draw AB = 10 cm; from A draw ray AX.
Step 2: Mark 11 equal points A1…A11 on AX.
Step 3: Join A11B.
Step 4: Through A4 draw a line ∥ A11B to meet AB at P. Then AP:PB = 4:7.
External:
Step 5: Extend AB beyond B.
Step 6: Through A7 draw line ∥ A11B to meet AB produced at Q (beyond B). Then AQ:QB = 4:7 (external).

text: [Application] On a site plan with scale 1:250, draw a driveway of actual length 32 m touching a circular lawn of plan radius 3.0 cm at exactly one point (tangent). Provide steps.
answer:
Step 1: Convert 32 m to drawing: 3200 cm / 250 = 12.8 cm. Decide driveway direction.
Step 2: Draw circle (O, 3.0 cm) for lawn.
Step 3: Choose external point T such that the driveway line through T will be 12.8 cm long.
Step 4: Find midpoint M of OT; draw circle (M, OM).
Step 5: Intersections with lawn circle give P and Q; choose the appropriate contact point (say P) in driveway direction.
Step 6: Draw tangent TP and mark the 12.8 cm driveway segment along TP.

text: [Application] Prepare a scaled elevation beam of actual 7.5 m at 1:150 and show a tangential brace touching a circular column of plan radius 1.6 cm at a point. Steps.
answer:
Beam:
Step 1: 7.5 m = 750 cm ⇒ drawing = 750/150 = 5 cm; draw 5 cm line segment.
Column tangent:
Step 2: Draw column circle (O, 1.6 cm).
Step 3: Pick external point T on beam line for brace endpoint.
Step 4: Construct midpoint M of OT; draw circle (M, OM).
Step 5: Intersection P with column circle gives contact point.
Step 6: Draw brace TP as tangent from T to the column.
